sermons.title: (Genesis) - Part 1
sermons.description: Tremendous lessons and warnings can be extracted from these opening verses of the Bible.  Zac Poonen labors in the Word of God to illustrate the fall of Lucifer (Satan) as a warning to believers of the consequences of having the same spirit of "I will go up."  The work of transformation upon the earth without form and void holds precious truths for followers of Jesus as to how to be transformed into His image and likeness!
sermons.preacher_description:
Zac Poonen ( - Present)
Listen to freely downloadable audio sermons by the speaker Zac Poonen in mp3 format. God called brother Zac Poonen to a new work early on in his Christian experience. The movement is now called Christian Fellowship Churches where the New Covenant of New Testament Christianity is clearly preached. 

Brother Zac Poonen has written 25 books most of them being on the deeper Christian life. Many of these have been translated into a number of languages and have been circulated widely around the world. He clearly and passionately shares the  narrow way of Christian discipleship that is neglected by so many modern preachers.

sermons.title: (Genesis) - Part 11
sermons.description: Have you seen the death of Jesus in the covenant of Noah's rainbow?  Brother Zac shows the safety of pressures and persecutions such as Noah faced for 120 years; his fall came in the time of ease.  We can learn from the curse of Ham to put to death this evil curiosity to see the nakedness of others, which manifests itself in many ways.

sermons.title: (Genesis) - Part 18
sermons.description: Lot lost his testimony in Sodom because it is our life that makes our testimony effective.  A true disciple is one who is not attached to anything in this world.  Abraham's lapse in Gerar is a warning that following great experiences or revelation from God to be very careful.  In our judgments of others we need to also be careful, for we may have judged Abraham a liar but God called him a prophet.

sermons.title: (Genesis) - Part 19
sermons.description: The birth of Isaac came at the end of Abraham and Sarah laying hold of God by faith despite their ups and downs.  Isaac and Isaac contrast believers under the old covenant (done in the strength of the flesh) and those of the new covenant, that which is done supernaturally.  God's tests come to see whether He is first in our life.  Abraham went against human reason, counted the cost, and obeyed God in offering Isaac, the first mention of worship and also a picture of the resurrection.

sermons.title: (Genesis) - Part 2
sermons.description: Have you considered the numerous references to God separating in the work of creation and what that means in principle for the Christian life?  Brother Zac shows the importance of separating the darkness of human traditions and worldliness from the light of God's revealed word in Christ.  What warning can we take heed to in that man and the animals were made on the same day?

sermons.title: (Genesis) - Part 20
sermons.description: The test that Abraham passed in offering up Isaac is whether he feared God or not.  We face this same test not in the areas we obey so easily but in immediate obedience in the things God speaks to our hearts in secret.  Our worship is not measured by our correct doctrine or what songs we sing but whether we give to God that which costs us something; it's our attitude towards God that matters most.

sermons.title: (Genesis) - Part 21
sermons.description: Brother Zac points out many principles for young people to trust God about a life's partner as well as pointing out Abraham's servant as a type of the Holy Spirit seeking a bride for Jesus.

sermons.title: (Genesis) - Part 23
sermons.description: The end of Isaac's life is summed up by the words, "His eyes grew dim."  The young man who spent his time meditating in the fields and praying for the birth of sons lost his spiritual discernment by loving food more than the will of God and lacking struggles in life because everything was handed to him.  Rebecca also serves as a warning to sisters who begin to think of themselves as the wife of no ordinary person and end up losing out.  This section contains much profitable counsel for parents in raising up godly children.

sermons.title: (Genesis) - Part 24
sermons.description: The vision of Jacob's ladder is shown to be the Lord Jesus in John 1, which pictures our Mediator as one who came all the way down to earth, on our level as a man.  God used a difficult employer (Laban) and two difficult wives (Leah and Rachel) to discipline and humble Jacob.  As believers, we need to have our eyes opened to see this Jacob in our flesh that God may deliver us.

sermons.title: (Genesis) - Part 26
sermons.description: Jacob's detour to Shechem shows us how important it is to be wholehearted and radical and how this transformation process can be.  In Shechem, Jacob ran into many problems, losing authority in the home and his daughters wandering the streets.  Esau's having kings long before Jacob's teaches that affliction is the true preparation for kingship.  Joseph serves as a challenge to have a heart open to God and also as a tremendous picture of Jesus Christ.

sermons.title: (Genesis) - Part 3
sermons.description: What are man's true priorities?  Is it more important to work for the Lord or fellowship with Him?  What is that raises man's life above the level of animals?  What value does an earthly occupation hold in the life of a Christian?  Zac answers these and more as he examines Genesis chapter 2.

sermons.title: (Genesis) - Part 6
sermons.description: "There is always hope in God's rebuke," says Zac Poonen, as he points out how hard work is a protection and the priorities of wife and mother are the marks of a spiritual woman.  The first prophecies of Scripture contain the defeat of Satan and Christ manifest in the flesh as well as His death, taking upon Himself all the curse of Genesis 3--sorrow, sweat, thorns, dust, sword and death.

sermons.title: (Genesis) - Part 7
sermons.description: When parents are not in fellowship with God and one another, that home is opened up to the devil's attack as it was with Cain and Abel.  The religion of Cain serves as a warning to us today if we exhibit Cain's anger against other believers who don't see eye-to-eye doctrinally or have the fire of God on their lives.  And from the very beginning, God preached a gospel of victory that sin is not to master you.

sermons.title: (Genesis) - Part 9
sermons.description: The days of Noah are characteristic of the days of the coming of Christ, days filled with sexual immorality and violence.  What does the building of the ark mean for the Church today?

sermons.title: (Genesis) Genesis 10 Intro
sermons.preacher_description:
J. Vernon McGee (1904 - 1988)
Listen to freely downloadable audio sermons by the speaker J. Vernon McGee in mp3 format. Brother McGee pastored an inter-denominational church, Church Of The Open Door in California. In 1967 he started the now famous "Through The Bible" radio program that airs on thousands of stations world-wide.

His burden has been to do systematic simple bible teaching to equip believers, protect them against false doctrines and share the whole counsel of God. He also has been a guest lecturer at the Dallas Theological Seminary.

sermons.title: Christ in Genesis #1: Adam's Tree
sermons.description: Why did God make a tree of life when Adam already had life?  What does it mean to live by life or by knowledge?  Stephen Kaung answers these questions as he shows from the first book of the Bible that the divine life of God is only in Christ.  This message is the first of 8 messages, each corresponding to the 8 biographies portrayed in Genesis, which all put together picture Christ, the Man after God's own heart.
sermons.preacher_description:
Stephen Kaung ( - Present)
Listen to freely downloadable audio sermons by the speaker Stephen Kaung in mp3 format. Stephen Kaung is a Chinese Chrisitan speaker and writer, and now living in Richmond, Virgina. At an early age was converted to Christianity and was active in the Methodist Church in China, with home his father was a minister. He first met watchman need in the early 1930's and joined Nee's indigenous christian work full-time, working with him until 1949 when he left China and became involved with Christian work in other ares of the Far East.

Stephen Kaung worked very closely with T Austin-Sparks until his death in 1972. His burden has been to allow a testimony of the Lord in the local assembly, and to help the saints see the great importance of the Church as God intended it. Stephen Kaung's major work has been to translate the writings of Watchman Nee into English, over 50 titles which have been published by his own organisation, Christian Fellowship Publishers (CFP), In Richmond, Virgina.

sermons.title: Christ in Genesis #2: Abel's Sacrifice
sermons.description: The conflict between Cain and Abel is a conflict between the flesh and faith.  Abel's faith looked for the blood of Christ to save him, whereas Cain trusted in the good works of his flesh and was rejected.  If you trust in the good works of the flesh, the murder and evil of the flesh is sure to manifest.

sermons.title: Genesis
sermons.preacher_description:
Jim Cymbala (1949 - Present)
Listen to freely downloadable audio sermons by the speaker Jim Cymbala in mp3 format. Brother Jim Cymbala was called into ministry without formal training in Brooklyn, New York to pastor a small gathering. God showed him the great need of prayer and depending on the work of the Holy Spirit in the ministry. God blessed and grew the brooklyn tabernacle to a large church of thousands because of this reliance.

The burden of his ministry is to show the vital need for prayer, deependence on God and that God uses the weak and lowly to build His kingdom. He has written many books including the best-selling: "Fresh Wind, Fresh Fire" and his newer book "Spirit Rising" speaking of the neglected work of the Holy Spirit in our churches these days.

Genesis #11 Ch. Mazzaroth - Testimony of the Stars
Genesis #13 Ch. 14-15 Contrast of Abraham and Lot
Genesis #20 Ch. 31-34 Wrestling to the End of Self
Genesis #22 Ch. 37-39 Joseph, The Faithful Servant
Genesis #24 Ch. 42-45 The Revelation of Joseph
Genesis) Genesis 34:10-17
sermons.description: A warning against marrying unbelievers. Central to the sermon is an account of a young woman who stubbornly ignored pastoral counsel and married an unconverted man only to experience heartache.

sermons.title: Joseph Reminds Me Of Jesus-05
sermons.preacher_description:
William MacDonald (1917 - 2007)
Listen to freely downloadable audio sermons by the speaker William MacDonald in mp3 format. Was President of Emmaus Bible College, teacher, Plymouth Brethren theologian and a prolific author of over 84 published books. MacDonald refused to accept royalties for his books but established a fund for translating his work Believers Bible Commentary into foreign languages.

   Bill will be not only be remembered for the thousands upon thousands of lives he touched through his books, teaching and many personal letters, but for his Christ-like character and gentleness, yet powerful life lived by faith in Christ. One of his most impact-ful books is the small booklet called: "True Discipleship" it is recommended reading for every serious disciple of Christ.

sermons.title: Through The Bible - Genesis - Part 1
sermons.description: Studying the Bible is not a quest for knowledge but life--to know what God would say to me.  The creation pictures several foundational principles of Christian living: remaking ruined humanity, separating light from darkness, and overcoming.  We also see the two streams running throughout the Bible--Babylon and Jerusalem--starting with two men who listened to the devil (Adam and Cain) and two men who walked with God (Enoch and Noah).
sermons.preacher_description:
Zac Poonen ( - Present)
Listen to freely downloadable audio sermons by the speaker Zac Poonen in mp3 format. God called brother Zac Poonen to a new work early on in his Christian experience. The movement is now called Christian Fellowship Churches where the New Covenant of New Testament Christianity is clearly preached. 

Brother Zac Poonen has written 25 books most of them being on the deeper Christian life. Many of these have been translated into a number of languages and have been circulated widely around the world. He clearly and passionately shares the  narrow way of Christian discipleship that is neglected by so many modern preachers.

sermons.title: Through The Bible - Genesis - Part 2
sermons.description: A lot in Genesis is fundamental in our understanding of God, likened to a seed from which out comes everything later on.  Genesis 10 & 11 highlight the beginnings of Babylon, a religious and monetary system that falsely promises to show you the gate to God.  Abraham is God's beginning of Jerusalem, a man of faith who learned to live by the words from God's mouth.
